intro: Robinsonella erasmi-sosae, commonly known as the Erasmi-Sosae fern, is a rare and delicate species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, intricate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with finely divided pinnae and a compact growth habit. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
